document_title: Lupus nephritis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
Out of every 10,000 people in the world, 3 people have lupus nephritis. The disease is more common in women than men, between the ages of 20 and 40. Factors that can increase the risk of disease include:
Genetics.; Sex.; Environmental factors: Tobacco, shingles virus, stress...
